## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
rairuoho<-read.table('https://www.dipintothereef.com/uploads/3/7/3/5/37359245/rairuoho.txt', header= T,
           sep= '\t',
            dec= '.')
library(tidyr)
vignette("pivot")
library(dplyr)
rairuoho2<- rairuoho%>%pivot_longer(
   cols= starts_with('day'),
    names_to= 'days',
    names_prefix= 'day',
    names_transform = list(days= as.integer),
    values_to= 'length',
    )
rairuoho3<- rairuoho2%>% select(spatial1, spatial2, days, length, treatment)
rairuoho4<- rairuoho3%>% unite('spatial_coordinates',
                                c(spatial1, spatial2),
                               sep= '_')
rairuoho4$treatment<- ifelse(rairuoho4$treatment== 'nutrient', 'enriched', 'water')
rairuoho4
```
